website_summaries.verdict: An under-the-bed safety ladder that can be extended to climb from third story windows.
pros: Folds to be placed under a bed
Extra-long length for third story windows
Great for apartment use as an extra emergency exit option
cons: This product is a little heavy (30 lbs.)
and might not be ideal for children's use

customer_reviews.title: Young children may find it difficult to deploy.
customer_reviews.text: It appears to be sturdy enough but my 7 and 10 year old grandkids had a very difficult time deploying this. The video I posted was their third fire drill and you can see what happened.
customer_reviews.author: 21st Century Computers

customer_reviews.title: It is reusable
customer_reviews.text: Great price and it's reusable. Read the description on your ladder before purchasing. Many are only a one time use but you can't practice with them. The practice is very important for children. They will do what they are taught. It must be drilled into them or they will panic during a fire. Give them the confidence to do what's necessary when/if disaster strikes.
customer_reviews.author: PBashore

customer_reviews.title: I am 185 pounds and I have tested this ladder ...
customer_reviews.text: I am 185 pounds and I have tested this ladder numerous times now... you can feel confident that this ladder is quality made and will handle at least a 185 man without fail. [...]
customer_reviews.author: Shane Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Tested and staged for an emergency.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my daughters house to ensure that her and her roommate would be able to get out safely. Had them test it to ensure that it would reach a reasonable distance that they would feel comfortable with. We tested this to ensure that there was enough window sill to hold it and not need a larger "hook" for the current window. Every thing checked out well and they are comfortable using it, placing it out the window and making that transition out the window and onto the ladder. This has given me one less thing to worry about! Not sure about the max weight that this thing would actually hold.
customer_reviews.author: Kaylr31

customer_reviews.title: Feel safer owning it, easy to unroll
customer_reviews.text: Tested it, easily rolls out; seems sturdy. Hope I never use it. I feel alot safer living on the third floor now that I own it
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the First Alert 2-story fire escape ladder
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the First Alert 2-story fire escape ladder. I just got done testing it with my son (from the ground climbing up) and overall I'm impressed. It doesn't have the stability of a real ladder, and does twist and move as you climb, however, this is to be expected. This is yet another reason why we practice fire safety so we can be aware of these things, and not panic should the time come to use it. I'm 180# and I felt safe and secure using it. I actually climbed all the way up to my window, and besides being a bit scared of the height, I didn't feel unsafe. Highly recommended for piece of mind and safety!
customer_reviews.author: Duff

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous and assembled incorrectly
customer_reviews.text: Dangerous! Put together backwards. It took me a little time to unpack this ladder and test it out. It is probably manageable for my 14 year old daughter's to attach to her window, however, the ladder is attached backwards to the window hooks making it impossible to use. The legs that should go against the house would sticking out in the air in a real emergency. I agree with other reviews that if put together properly, this ladder would be difficult for young children.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to use and my kids were able to set it up and get out of our house by themselves in a fire drill. It is a little bit heavy for them, but they managed at 5, 7, and 9 years old. They took turns and all know how to do it! We have one in each of our upstairs bedrooms.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Dieckmann

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good product but internal labeling is misleading.
customer_reviews.text: Looks like it will work well, but there's some inconsistencies in the labeling and packaging. Add and box say it's a 14-ft ladder, but the rungs measure 12 feet with MAYBE another foot for the first part. Says it should be used as high as 2nd floor or 16 feet. Oddly, the additional instructions attached to ladder itself say it's good for 3 stories and that the ladder itself is something like 16 feet. So that's just weird. Manual has some good ideas about how and where to place it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Jans

customer_reviews.title: Tests well, think it will work well.
customer_reviews.text: Something I purchased that I hope I will never use. I did take it out of the box and tested it. (I'm not going to wait until I'm panicked). It folded back up nicely (yes, it takes a bit of time). It held my weight well (middle aged overweight lady).
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi Y

customer_reviews.title: Only good for kids
customer_reviews.text: It’s not practical for adults, only good for kids. ladder it self is narrow and not secure.
customer_reviews.author: Roj30

customer_reviews.title: I feel much safer!
customer_reviews.text: Jumping out the second story of a burning house really didn't appeal to me. This was an excellent and reasonably priced solution. This was the sturdiest of the roll-out ladders I found and it is not too heavy for me to use. It's small enough to fit in a cabinet or closet near the window where I'll use it and it's easy to install, use and refold. I also like that it's long enough to reach near the ground. I plan to get at least one more for the other side of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Denise MacBayne Nuno

customer_reviews.title: Not Secure - wouldn't hold
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product design. I was so excited to find a reasonably priced 3-story ladder. Luckily, we tested it out when we got it to make sure we know how to use it in the event of a fire. The top part that is supposed to secure the ladder to the window sill was too wide and would never hold a step on the first rung. DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: CV Lut

customer_reviews.title: Tested out my 2 story window! #survived
customer_reviews.text: It was a Tuesday afternoon when I popped the screen out of the second-floor window as onlookers gathered outside. I unfurled the easy fold ladder to the windowsill and dropped it below to the gasps of the onlookers two stories below. And so I began my decent, 220 pounds of skepticism. As I made my way down my confidence made its way up. Safely on the ground I looked back up awestruck and this product. I shouted to the crowd, “buy this ladder, lest ye be trapped!”
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE! Not good from a balcony.
customer_reviews.text: I almost returned this because if your escaping from a balcony and you have arthritis your gonna need a second safety line. They show their use from a wall but brutal from a balcony. You go from vertical to horizontal and your feet are useless to support your weight. The ladder is well made and I’m keeping it. If your young and strong no problem. For the rest of us seniors, BUY A SAFETY FALL LINE as well or else.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: ... what it’s supposed to do but it’s complicated and easily tangled. Unpackaged it to use for practice and ...
customer_reviews.text: It does what it’s supposed to do but it’s complicated and easily tangled. Unpackaged it to use for practice and was nearly impossible to get it repackaged.
customer_reviews.author: Eric M. Backensto

customer_reviews.title: This ladder can be used and easily put back in the box to use again
customer_reviews.text: I looked all over to find an escape ladder that wasn't just a one time use ladder. I wanted my children to practice using this before they had to in a fire. This ladder can be used and easily put back in the box to use again. The ladder is very strong and sturdy. It is heavier then some of the other ladders I looked at but during an emergency I wanted a ladder that would hold everyone. The hooks on the ladder are very large and fit nicely over all of our different sized window sills. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: jend

customer_reviews.title: not for all window sills
customer_reviews.text: It's not in the product description, but this only works for window sills up to about 13 inches thick. Fine for homes, but many apartment buildings (where this would be very useful!) have wider sills. The ladder looks like it would work great if it fits, but the description has to be updated.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: It seems well built to use in case of emergency ...
customer_reviews.text: It seems well built to use in case of emergency. However, it seems off to me that they are suggested as a one time use. Of course that makes sense in case of a real fire. However, the directions deter opening for practice use, which I think should be mandatory. After all, who wants to be in an emergency situation and not have practiced how to properly hang and exit on a ladder?
customer_reviews.author: JaLo

customer_reviews.title: A great company who makes a great product and keeping our great family safe.
customer_reviews.text: one of my reasons for getting this is that it has individual rubber caps on the pegs as you're coming down the ladder it prevents you from slipping or scratching or damaging the individual vinyl pieces on the side wall of your house. The materials are very well made the item is sturdy and have tea but not overly so where they can't be pulled out and used by older child or spouse. One thing I do like is that we have a way out of the house so thank you for making us safe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but it's a really good idea to practice with it before you need to ...
customer_reviews.text: I chose this over other options because it can be used multiple times. What? Are you expecting multiple fires? No ... but it's a really good idea to practice with it before you need to use it in an emergency. A one-time use ladder will not allow for that. I bought this for my daughter's family, so I can't speak to how easily it unfolds or how comfortable it is to climb. But this one consideration made it a "must buy."
customer_reviews.author: REL

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but very specific placement needs
customer_reviews.text: The product is sturdy. I wouldn’t hesitate climbing down it. The problem is the number of variables to consider before purchasing. Consider your homes structure carefully when reading the needs of this ladder.
customer_reviews.author: stbarry

customer_reviews.title: but these ladders are excellent quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews, but these ladders are excellent quality for the price. Easy to use, sturdy, packaged well. Best thing is that I could open them and let my kids practice attaching them to their windowseal so now they feel more comfortable if they should ever have to use them. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: teejayk

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind you hope to never use
customer_reviews.text: Let's face it, you hope this product never gets used. Our house is built into a hillside, with the front 12 to 16 feet above grade. If we can't get out of the house in an emergency, we have the option to throw this ladder over the window and escape on the high side. The unit is well made, sturdy, and in a test run it worked very well. It comes in a nice cardboard box to store under the bed. Hope we never need it, but the peace of mind knowing it is there, is worth every penny we paid.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Wolford

customer_reviews.title: This will be great in an emergency
customer_reviews.text: This will be great in an emergency. It is really heavy though. I bought the 2 and 3 story to put in my kids rooms. One of their rooms is a little higher so I got the 3 story ladder. I wish that I would have gotten the 2 story instead as it was big enough and not as heavy. I do worry that my kids may struggle putting it up if they need to use it. I love that we were able to use it to practice and put it away to have for an emwegency. A lot of other ladders are single use only
customer_reviews.author: Karine

customer_reviews.title: Better to have it & not need it than to need it & not have it
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those things for which you can't give an accurate review unless you use it first. I live on the 3rd story of my apt bldg, with only the front door & kitchen window (3 ft from the front door) as exits without a long drop. So while I can't review it's performance, I can say it give me much more peace of mind knowing I can get out through a window and not end up with 2 broken legs if the door is ever blocked by flames. And that peace of mind is well worth the purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: Ian S.

customer_reviews.title: Tangled much too easily; not a good option for my younger children ...
customer_reviews.text: Tangled much too easily; not a good option for my younger children to deal with on their own in the event of a fire.
customer_reviews.author: Jones

customer_reviews.title: I'm Satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made product and at a great price. Unlike other similar products, this ladder allows the user to practice and easily repack it for emergencies. Under stress, it's very easy to put into use. I'm satisfied and I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: ajaxcop

customer_reviews.title: When I tried to test this ladder out of my ...
customer_reviews.text: When I tried to test this ladder out of my window, the hinge in the middle of the top made it impossible to secure it. The hinge kept bending. If there were some way to stabilize the hinge I think it would work... I will have to modify it myself to make it usable.
customer_reviews.author: Annastasia Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself because my granddaughter spends weekends with me and I live in a townhouse type apt where bedrooms are upstairs. I bought a second one for my 27 year old son. He live in a 2nd story apartment where the homes are so close together. If a neighbor's house burns, it will quickly spread and he had only 1 exit. Now he had 2! Peace of mind is worth everything! With this ladder, we have a chance to escape tragedy. Best part.... it's reusable so you can have fire drills and it can be collapsed and packed up for the real thing!
customer_reviews.author: Misspattie518

customer_reviews.title: Awful product
customer_reviews.text: Awful . I’m shocked that this is made by First Alert. It’s something that you never ever want to have to use but if you have too, i wouldn’t depend on it as your only escape plan.
customer_reviews.author: jenny

customer_reviews.title: I hope we won’t ever need, but these will work!
customer_reviews.text: As licensed foster parents, we’re required to have one upstairs emergency ladder, but it made more sense to get 2 emergency ladders - one for each the front side of the second level and one for the back side of the second level. If we have an emergency, I want us to be able to get out quickly. It’s heavy but after I hung it inside to evaluate just how heavy, I’m confident it will provide a strong exit strategy for our family to get out safely. It takes some time, but the ladders do compact back to the small packing box.
customer_reviews.author: DS3570

customer_reviews.title: Damaged, defective, used (bought as new), and tangled
customer_reviews.text: This “NEW” Fire emergency ladder came without a box or printed instructions/specs. It was in a tangled mess that was just thrown into a brown shipping box with some brown paper padding. It had missing plastic protector ends on the feet and had visible damage from its previous use. There is no way this could be used as intended in an emergency without risking our lives untangling it. I’m returning this used and defective product ASAP. First Alert should be ashamed of themselves for their lack of quality control, on an emergency device nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: First Aid Portable Ladder
customer_reviews.text: Last Feb 2019, I bought thru amazon First Alert 3 storey portable ladder. When it was delivered less than a week, I immediately check it. Very satisfied of the product, the strap that holds steps ladder are durable and lightly attached of the bolt, the step ladders are durable and light..and the holder that will be put in the window....perfect. I haven't use the item cause it's for fire but i'm confident that when the time comes, I'll be safely reach ground. At first I hesitate buying because I'm the type that see first before payment...but I didn't regret trusting Amazon/first alert product.
customer_reviews.author: Elena Amolong, Philippines

customer_reviews.title: Save a life
customer_reviews.text: Since my daughter lives in the second floor and it’s quite a distance to the stairway. This was a brilliant idea to invest in case of a emergency. The part I like very much with this ladder is a person don’t have to use excessive strength when using this stiff ladder
customer_reviews.author: E. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver...Literally
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these right after our apartment complex caught on fire, displacing 4 families. I am moving into a new home and don't need these any more, so I gave them to two different families that have small children and live on the top floors. These are very Heavy duty, easy to unfold and mount to the window or a balcony, and is extremely sturdy and durable! A MUST have if you or someone you love lives on the top floor.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie M.

customer_reviews.title: but I feel better with them having it of course
customer_reviews.text: Gave to my daughter and son n law, for Christmas present, hope they never have to use it, but I feel better with them having it of course, living in two story home with 3 kids , if u live in a two story home I suggest u get this
customer_reviews.author: Susan L.

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, bad Shipping Package
customer_reviews.text: Ladder is great. 5 year old was able to climb out the window easily (we tested it 10 times haha) easy to unfold and install, easy to refold. The shipping packaging needs some work. They shipped it in the box it comes in. The box was tore pretty bad. There wasn’t any damage to the ladder but definitely inspect it. I would still recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ben from Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe
customer_reviews.text: I attached this to my upstairs window, a simple pull and it slides off the window sill and lands in the person below. I am not sure how it’s considered “anti-slip” but good luck if you have to use it... hope you don’t break your Coccyx. Returning this product right away.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Great for constant use & thick sills
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted! I was worried wouldn’t fit because the sill is so deep, but the construction allows it to grab just the inside sill to the outside of the window- does not need to go to the outside of the brick. Easily can put on and off and go up and down, we use it as a regular to go to the backyard (NYC apt).
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 5

customer_reviews.title: Good investment!
customer_reviews.text: Works just as described. The ladders are very good quality. they are just a little heavy for younger kids are maybe even elderly folks. But with practice I was able to teach my older son how to use it. Gives a great peace of mind to my wife knowing the kids will have a way out in case of an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H.

customer_reviews.title: Not a 1 time use ladder
customer_reviews.text: We never got the first 1 it was delivered to the wrong house but amazon stepped in and ordered another which we did get and im very happy with the quality of it and the price was gonna order a cheaper 1 but it was a 1 time use why would i want a 1 time use makes no sense really read the discription befor you buy for 32$ its a bargain
customer_reviews.author: Ellen D

customer_reviews.title: I hope to never use it....
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy and has some weight to it. Bought for my 2nd floor bedrooms. Practiced attaching to the window and seems easy enough to use. Though it's not very wide so I think it may be difficult to navigate. It seems it will sway alot due to the narrow ladder rungs. Hope to never find out but gives me some peace of mind as shound it be needed.
customer_reviews.author: D, Sanatoga, PA

customer_reviews.title: Too complex for quick action.
customer_reviews.text: I did not open up the bottom part of the ladder because just the bars that hook over the window sill were very difficult to align and figure out. If there were a fire, I think it would take me too long to get this ladder properly put out my window. Think I would do better with a knotted rope.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: I feel safer
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product after moving to a 2nd story home. Tried it out on the window and it is easy to install in case of an emergency. What’s better is that it was easy to take up again and store again. So glad I purchased this item. It brings my family and me peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: I feel comfortable with this ladder in an emergency
customer_reviews.text: Other than being a bit on the heavy side, I feel comfortable with this ladder in an emergency. My 6 year old, 10 year old, wife and myself had a "fire drill" and we all successfully climbed down on it from about an 18' window.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Shuemaker

customer_reviews.title: It's difficult to rate something you hope not to use ...
customer_reviews.text: It's difficult to rate something you hope not to use. We live in a two story house. The only way out in case of a fire is down the stairs. Obviously, a window is the only option out if the fire is coming up the stairwell. The product seems to be well made and should to the trick if needed. I gave it a four star based on it's construction.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Soucier

customer_reviews.title: Child deployable
customer_reviews.text: Works well during trials. 5 to our 9 year old were able to deploy and descend from second storey window with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: JOSE

customer_reviews.title: The product is as you see it here. Putting ...
customer_reviews.text: The product is as you see it here. Putting it back "together" after deploying it can be a bit frustrating but very doable and definitely a plus over the "one-use" alternatives. The height before the first rung is a bit low though for younger kids; my 5.5 yo son who's almost 4ft tall canNOT safely reach the first rung (or get off it, climbing up). Even when trying to deploy it as instructed, I found the reach to be quite a bit far before I could actually grasp the release. One more rung at the top would really make this stellar.
customer_reviews.author: Jeancarlo

customer_reviews.title: Multiple Use
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these- one for each of my children's rooms. I'm so happy to know they are multiple use ladders so that we can start practicing on them monthly with the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Jean

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a family member who lives on the third floor of an apartment building. In case of a fire she would have to get to the far end of her floor to get to the stairs. Hopefully she will never need this but it’s comforting to know she could escape.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Dutton

customer_reviews.title: Good quality good price
customer_reviews.text: The ladder seems pretty durable. Plus you can open it up and try it out. Some of the others brands are one-time use only - that makes no sense at all. You need to practice at least setting this up before an emergency actually happens. The only complaint that I have is that the curved pieces that attach to the window sill should be a little larger. They go around to the inside of the window, but barely reach below the window sill. I was a little concerned that it wouldn't stay on when the full weight of an adult was on the ladder. Other than that, it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bainbridge

customer_reviews.title: Way too floppy; could kill your self just trying ...
customer_reviews.text: Way too floppy; could kill your self just trying it out even without a fire! Would not purchase or use any higher than about 8 feet.
customer_reviews.author: James C. Van Avery

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I unpacked this to ensure that the steps were threaded correctly since a couple reviews mentioned an issue with that. Mine was threaded correctly. I was able to unfold it and refold it easily for packing.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Jones

customer_reviews.title: Looks sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t tried this out but I opened the box and it looks sturdy. Has some weight to it and seems like it will be great in an emergency. I’ll have to test it out on our balcony and see hone it works.
customer_reviews.author: Camila Perry

customer_reviews.title: Misleading weight limit in description
customer_reviews.text: Product description says it's tested to over 1125 lbs. Package states 375 lb weight limit. False advertising on their part
customer_reviews.author: Chris Adamczyk

customer_reviews.title: Happy with Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I haven't removed the ladder from the box but my initial impression is that it is very well made amd sturdy. It comes with detailed instructions and seems easy to use. I'm happy to have this as part of my home fire safety kit.
customer_reviews.author: WVPersephone13

customer_reviews.title: Looks Robust
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to use this yet, and hopefully never will. It seems to be well built and sturdy, easy to unfold in an emergency. Good value and slim enough to fit under out bed.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Mills

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy Product
customer_reviews.text: I live on the 2nd floor of a condo building and this ladder is perfect. I took it out of the box for a test run and it's exactly what I expected. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra F

customer_reviews.title: Glad I Didn't Need It For A Fire
customer_reviews.text: When I Went To Unroll It, It Got Tangled Up. I Had To Take The U-Bolts Off To Untangle It. The End Caps On The Rungs Fell Off. I'll Silicone Them In Later. But It Did Serve My Purpose For It (Cleaning The Inside Of A Water Holding Tank).
customer_reviews.author: Loo In NY

customer_reviews.title: cannot securely hook on window
customer_reviews.text: It can be a risk when this ladder cannot hook securely on the window
customer_reviews.author: Vivian

customer_reviews.title: Sleep well knowing you have an out.
customer_reviews.text: We feel better knowing this ladder is in the middle upstairs bedroom, ready for an emergency. I bought the 3 story size, because we have a porch roof and would rather have more ladder than less.
customer_reviews.author: Breeze3at

customer_reviews.title: A must have for 2nd story homes.
customer_reviews.text: These should just come with the home when you buy it... Fire safety and preventing the lose of a loved ones life is something you cant put a price tag on... this escape ladder is compact.. well designed.. strong enough for multiple use which means you can test it out and practice.. which I highly recommend you doing. The only con is if there is a window directly below your escape window on the 1st floor, it might get broken due to the pressure from the ladder being put up against it. But when your life depends on it.. Who really cares?
customer_reviews.author: Nate King

customer_reviews.title: Really heavy-- no ways kids could use it
customer_reviews.text: SO heavy. I'm not sure how I would be able to manage in an emergency, but glad I have it for peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Please like my review

customer_reviews.title: I did open the box and they do look like they are well put together and well made
customer_reviews.text: I purchase these for my niece's home, and my sister's home. Haven't been able to give them to either of them as of yet. However, I did open the box and they do look like they are well put together and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle mshumate

customer_reviews.title: Great, Sturdy Ladder
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my parents since they have an upstairs bedroom. We unfurled it and set it up on the window to test it, but didn't get too far with our test because as soon as my dad stepped onto it the windowsill started to bend. The ladder didn't slip or anything, though, it seemed very sturdy. I'd just be careful of your windowsill if you're going to test it. But that's what I like about this ladder- you can test it because it's reusable. Some of the ones I was considering along with this one supposedly were not reusable. It seems like a very good product, I just hope it never has to be used.
customer_reviews.author: SWilliams

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put up or down. Floss down to a small size for storage. Clearly we had a different use in mind then fire escape but it was exactly what we needed. The only thing is I wish the center bar on top locked into place.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Well made, good ladder
customer_reviews.text: Looks well made, good to use, and collapses down to a reasonable size for storage. One of those things you hope you'll never have to use, but is good to have.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Finn

customer_reviews.title: A must have in my house! Great product
customer_reviews.text: You should have this in your house if you have a second floor and don't have escape ladders. This one has been approved by the state so that's the reason I chose this ladder and its reusable a definite plus, we have to be able to do drills and I'm glad that my family is able to do drills with this to be familiar with it.
customer_reviews.author: Treshawna-SG

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Ladder
customer_reviews.text: I love this ladder, it's very easy to use and seems pretty sturdy. As an active firefighter I stress over the fact that we won't be able to get out of the house if we ever had a fire because of the way my upstairs is layed out. I also like that it's reusable cause apparently not all of them are.
customer_reviews.author: joseph abbaticchio

customer_reviews.title: This was a gift
customer_reviews.text: My single daughter lived in an upper apartment in an old house, with only one set of stairs out the front door. Being a Mom, I worried about a fire in the front of the apartment where the only stairs were. I got her this for emergency access out one of the windows, or off the railing of her deck off the kitchen. She never had to use it, but told me it was both light weight and strong, and she thought she could easily handle it, put it in place, and use it if she had to. She and I both felt more secure knowing she had it.

Be prepared for an emergency with the First Alert EL53W-2 Three-Story Portable Home Fire-Escape Ladder. House fires can be deadly, but the EL53W-2 helps protect you and your family by providing a safe, reliable means of escape.




EL53 Fire Escape Ladder

Strong enough to help both children and
adults quickly exit to safety. View larger.Escape from a Dangerous House Fire with This Strong, Durable Ladder
Fire is a serious threat to every household; it can strike anywhere, any time. The frightening truth is that in 2005, there were nearly 381,000 home fires in the U.S., resulting in over 16,000 casualties. Because of the very real threat of fire, it is vital that every household uses tools for fire protection. When used in conjunction with smoke alarms and fire extinguishers, and as part of an overall fire-escape plan, the EL53W-2 is an effective last-resort tool to help you and your family safely exit a dangerous situation.Tough Nylon/Steel Construction, Anti-Slip Rungs, and Secure Hooks
Exceptionally durable, this ladder is tested to American Society for Testing and Materials (ASTM) standards. Featuring strong nylon/steel construction and measuring 24 feet in length, the EL5W-2 provides a dependable means of escape through a third-floor window during a home fire.

This ladder is easy to set up and is strong enough to help both children and adults quickly exit to safety. It arrives fully assembled and ready to use in one minute. Extra-wide hooks secure the ladder to any windowsill measuring at least 20 inches (51 centimeters) wide and 32 inches (81 centimeters) high with a sill width between a minimum of 6 inches (15 centimeters) and a maximum of 13 inches (33 centimeters).

The ladder's slip-resistant, epoxy-coated rungs provide sure footing, and steel stabilizers on each rung help keep your feet steady and balanced, preventing the rungs from swaying as you step on or off of them. For added stability, DuPont Cordura nylon strapping lends extra strength and durability, while steel construction tested to 1,125 pounds means this ladder safely holds up to 375 pounds at a time.

The EL53W-2 comes with a six-year limited warranty.
